definition: to overstep the bounds of what is proper/to take sth too far/(of a measuring device) to go off the scale

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively

sentences.english: There is nothing out of the common course of life in my doing this.
sentences.chinese: 我這麼辦，循的是人生的常規，毫無出格之處。

sentences.english: Hostess But even here among the virgins, there is something else going on.
sentences.chinese: 但即使在單性生殖的動物中，也有出格的事情發生。

sentences.english: Do be careful with these fireworks, a slight spark could set them off.
sentences.chinese: 這些個炊火要出格小心，稍有火星就能導致爆炸。

sentences.english: Taking time to go, see a postage labels vending machines, then send a few franker and bought several new ticket.
sentences.chinese: 那時也並沒有出格地存眷，只以爲是一種新地標籤。

sentences.english: Some placards went further, depicting Nazi swastikas on the French flag.
sentences.chinese: 有些標語則更加出格，在法國國旗上描繪了納粹標誌。

sentences.english: Mayes said the babies were beingcared for in intensive care in Belfast.
sentences.chinese: 梅斯說，嬰兒們正在貝爾法斯特受到出格護理。

sentences.english: More tha great 5 years; simply less tha great 10 years. 14 days.
sentences.chinese: 任職滿5年以上未滿10年者全年給14天出格休假。

sentences.english: Today's special is roast leg of lamb.
sentences.chinese: 今日的出格菜是烤羊腿。

sentences.english: Daniel Pay attention to punctuation, especially to the correct use of commas and periods.
sentences.chinese: 注重標點，出格是逗點和句號的不錯施用要領。

sentences.english: So we should choose some good programs to watch, especially for children.
sentences.chinese: 所以我們應該拔取一些好節目來看，出格是對孩子們。

sentences.english: Article 56 The Executive Council of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region shall be presided over by the Chief Executive.
sentences.chinese: 第半百六條香港出格行政區行政會議由行政長官主持。

sentences.english: She is a notorious gossiper here, who is very fond of dishing the dirt about others.
sentences.chinese: 她出格喜歡說別人的閒話，是我們這出了名的長舌婦。

sentences.english: It was morning but the winter sky was dark.
sentences.chinese: 一個冬天的早晨，天色出格陰晦。

sentences.english: I dig songs and Ilike pop music very much.
sentences.chinese: 我出格喜歡歌曲和流行音樂。

sentences.english: This shop sells a wide range of watches all of which are the choicest.
sentences.chinese: 這家商展賣的腕錶都是精品，而且種類還出格多。

sentences.english: Her little flirtation with Drouet seemed now an extraordinary thing.
sentences.chinese: 她和杜洛埃的那一段小小的調情現在看來似乎出格了。

definition: to run off the track/to step out of line/to overstep the bounds of propriety
to offend Heaven and reason (idiom); bloody atrocities that cry to heaven/outrageous acts
to go too far (in word or deed)/over the top
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
to be content with one's lot (idiom)/to know one's place

pinyin: zheng1 yi1 zhi1 yan3 bi4 yi1 zhi1 yan3

definition: to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
